href="https://utcc.utoronto.ca/~cks/space/blog/programming/Go121ToolchainDownloads"/>; <author>; <name>;todsacerdoti</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=todsacerdoti</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;Starting in Go 1.21, Go will refuse to be optimistic when an older version of Go tries to do something with a module that requires a newer version of Go. Go guarantees that a module will always be processed with at least its minimum version of Go, and if this isn't possible, Go will stop with a clear error message. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#go-1-21-will-probably-download-newer-toolchains-on-demand-by-default" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36454895" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;PDF Subpage Navigation</stitle>; <id>;https://nibblestew.blogspot.com/2023/06/pdf-subpage-navigation.html</id>; <updated>;2023-06-24T01:55:29.838381Z</updated>; <link href="https://nibblestew.blogspot.com/2023/06/pdf-subpage-navigation.html"/>; <author>; <name>;ingve</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=ingve</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;<img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiNX9aSbr81YEYnyTOan3LX-2Qz0M2bVybxtBMsPEv4jzqb5fYSSp5aSq2AZeQRoknWRa5YwgL9n7yUujUi8yAOjQPAccjj5KSijgxg_1OeeRosvl9T4KldOZ7cAfRnAk33bjppyRRoSzooOOg0yYF6ureUfqeubDg3ys7VB8tZWIYQcuiAGZRyinULDEo/s320/subnav.png" style="width: 220px; height: 97px;" />;<br />;A common presentation requirement is to have bullet points appear one by one as you click forward. Most PDF presentations achieve this by having multiple pages, one for each state. However, the PDF specification has a feature called subpage navigation that allows for bullet points to appear on the same page. This feature is not widely used, and the PDF viewer that supports it is Acrobat Reader. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#pdf-subpage-navigation" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36454556" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;Wearable device that records your voice for legal defense</stitle>; <id>;https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36457266</id>; <updated>;2023-06-24T10:55:29.838799Z</updated>; <link href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36457266"/>; <author>; <name>;MrBigplan</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=MrBigplan</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;It is possible to record your own voice during a conversation without the other person's consent. This can be done using a wearable device that uses a contact microphone. The recorded voice can be stored alongside time information in an unalterable medium, such as a blockchain, to provide evidence for legal defense. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#wearable-device-that-records-your-voice-for-legal-defense" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36457266" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; <entry xml:base="https://hackernews.betacat.io/feed.xml">; <title type="text">;An interactive guide to color and contrast</stitle>; <id>;https://colorandcontrast.com/</id>; <updated>;2023-06-23T22:55:29.839965Z</updated>; <link href="https://colorandcontrast.com/"/>; <author>; <name>;warrenm</name>; <uri>;https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=warrenm</uri>; </author>; <content type="html">;Color & Contrast is a comprehensive guide to color for user interface designers. <a href="https://hackernews.betacat.io/#an-interactive-guide-to-color-and-contrast" target="_blank">;[summary]</a>; <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36449072" target="_blank">;[comments]</a>;</content>; </entry>; </feed>;
